sen.j: 吉田俊太郎（よしだ しゅんたろう、嘉永2年（1849年） - ?）は、丹波国篠山出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Shuntaro Yoshida (1849 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Sasayama, Tanba Province.
Shuntaro YOSHIDA (1849 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Sasayama, Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: Yoshida を大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Shuntaro YOSHIDA (1849 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Sasayama, Tanba Province.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）、新選組に入隊。
局長近藤勇の側近を務める。
sen.e: He served as a close retainer of Isami KONOD, Head of Shinsengumi.
He served as a close retainer of Isami KONOD, Head of Shinsengumi.
He served as a close retainer of Isami KONOD, Head of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争が起こり、近藤勇が新政府軍へ出頭すると、山口二郎（斎藤一）らと共に会津戦争に参戦し、如来堂の戦いで離散。
sen.e: When Isami KONDO, Head of Shinsengumi, presented himself to the New government army in Nagareyama City when the Boshin War broke out, he fought in the Aizu War, but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.
When Isami KONDO presented himself to the New government army in Nagareyama City when the Boshin War broke out, he fought in the Aizu War, but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.
sen.cmt: 近藤勇の説明が、前述でされていたので、省略しました。
sen.e: When Isami KONDO presented himself to the New government army in Nagareyama City when the Boshin War broke out, he fought in the Aizu War, but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.

sen.j: 久米部正親らと共に敗走を続け、明治元年（1868年）10月、銚子市で新政府軍に降伏した。
sen.e: He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the New government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the new government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
sen.cmt: New を new に変更しました。
sen.e: He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the new government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
